features: 9” Pizza, 4 Slices of Bread - The compact toaster oven fits nicely on the countertop, while the curved interior makes room for 9” pizzas and 4 slices of bread.
Four Functions - The stainless steel toaster oven’s cooking functions include: baking, broiling, toasting, and keeping food warm
30-Minute Timer - The timer includes precise toast settings and stay-on functionality.
Removable Crumb Tray - Keep the toaster oven clean with the convenient removable crumb tray.
body.description: Large enough for a 9” pizza or four slices of bread, the BLACK+DECKER 4-Slice Stainless Steel Toaster Oven with Broiler Pan complements any kitchen countertop. This compact, versatile toaster oven bakes, broils, toasts, and keeps food warm, at up to 450°F. It comes with a baking and broiler pan that fits perfectly into the small toaster oven interior. Plus, our exclusive EvenToast Technology optimizes heat distribution to toast bread evenly. When it’s time to eat, trust the #1 brand in toaster ovens*—BLACK+DECKER. Large viewing window keep an eye on food during cooking. The durable glass window gives you a clear view of food throughout the cooking process. Bake/broiler pan don’t worry about finding pans to fit in the oven. The included baking/broiling pan fits perfectly, making it easy to insert and remove food. Toasting rack also included.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Key Features Capacity The interior fits a 9” pizza, four slices of bread, or a variety of other snacks and meals. EvenToast Technology The toaster oven interior is specially designed for even toasting of up to 4 slices of bread at a time. Four Cooking Functions Choose from convection bake, broil, toast, and keep warm. 30-Minute Timer The 30-minute cooking timer features a stay-on function for longer baking tasks, and a precise toast timer with shade options.

BLACK+DECKER 4-Slice Convection Oven, Stainless Steel, Black, TO1313SBD Large enough for a 9” pizza or four slices of bread, the BLACK+DECKER 4-Slice Stainless Steel/Black Toaster Oven complements any kitchen countertop. This compact, versatile toaster oven bakes, broils, toasts, and keeps food warm, at up to 450°F. It comes with a baking pan and a broiler pan that fit perfectly into the small toaster oven interior. Plus, our exclusive EvenToast Technology optimizes heat distribution for more perfect toast*. *vs. standard BLACK+DECKER Toaster Ovens without EvenToast Technology Features Fits 9” Pizza or 4 Slices of Bread EvenToast Technology 4 Functions: Bake, Broil, Toast, Keep Warm 30-Minute Timer Bake Pan and Broil Rack Included

Black/Stainless Steel Find a fit for your kitchen with the black and stainless steel exterior. Viewing Window Keep a close watch on food while it bakes without opening the oven door. Removable Crumb Tray Easily remove food crumbs before they burn in the bottom of the oven. Easy Controls Three knobs control cooking: the top knob controls the temperature, the middle knob sets the cooking function, and the bottom knob acts as the timer for baking, broiling, and toasting. Black/Stainless Steel Viewing Window Removable Crumb Tray Easy Controls

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I've had this toaster oven for about a month now and, after doing some scavenger hunting on the internet for instructions and a little trial and error, I think it's going to pretty much replace my regular gas oven.Let me save you a little frustration as to the lack of instructions, especially pertaining to the convection feature. If you select the "Bake" setting, the convection feature is activated. There is no way to turn it off, which is actually fine.What I have discovered is, if I'm baking baked goods (cookies, muffins, etc) you need to decrease the baking temperature by 25 degrees or reduce the baking time by about 25 %, or both. If you reduce the temp, start checking for doneness about 3/4 of the way through the baking process.If I'm baking a casserole, which contains more liquids or the like('cream of' soups, eggs, cheese, etc) I use the recommended temperature in the recipe and let it cook the full amount of time. I made a tuna noodle casserole last week and it was perfect using the recipe exactly as written.I haven't used the broil feature for meat yet, so I don't have a point of reference for that feature and, as I'm single and just make toast in a regular 2 slice toaster, I also don't have a review for the toast feature (I don't need 8 slices of toast at once.)What I LOVE about this oven is being able to use my regular pans! I had a smaller toaster oven before and got frustrated by having to buy special pans for it. I ended up buying a lot of disposable aluminum pans. With this oven, I can use all of my regular pans (I have several Pampered Chef ones that I wasn't able to use in the old toaster oven) except for a couple of my larger baking stones. So far, everything has baked so much more evenly than in my full sized gas oven that I'm absolutely thrilled.So, as far as the way the oven functions and the results I've had when cooking with it, I am very satisfied with this oven. The only negative comment that I have about it is that the instructions are almost non-existent. An individual shouldn't have to do 2 hours of research online and watch youtube videos to learn how to properly use this product. They really need to include an actual instruction manual, with a few recipes included for each feature of the oven, instead of a big sheet of pitiful basic instructions that are written in about a dozen different languages. I think that most of the negative reviews that I've seen could have been avoided if this were the case. Does the outside of the oven get hot? Yes, it's a toaster oven, not an insulated range, so move it away from the wall. The crumb tray slides into the slots underneath the OUTSIDE of the oven, it doesn't go inside and I believe this is the reason that so many people are saying it never gets hot enough. The convection feature comes on and stays on when baking, there's no way to shut it off. All of this could should be explained in an actual instruction manual.My last comment pertains to the price. At $67 in November, this oven was a great value. Less than a month later, it's $96!!!! Had it been this price originally, I'm not sure I would have purchased it.So, my review is A for the the oven itself, D for the lack of instructions and the $30 price hike just before Christmas.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A New Version of my Old Black and Decker Toaster Oven
reviews.reviewText: I wish the crumb tray slid out as the old one did, but the controls are the same (easy and accurate once you learn to use them) and it is perfect for my toast, bagels, and heated pizza and appetizers. The small size is good for my limited counter space--I just don't have room for a convection oven type.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice basic toaster oven
reviews.reviewText: This is a nice, very basic toaster oven and for the low price, this is about what you should expect. It has a small footprint, so it works well in a small kitchen with limited counter space. That small footprint translates into a small oven cavity so forget about baking a cake in there. A couple of medium potatoes will fit fine (but see 3 below). The temperature control seems reasonably accurate.A few of negatives (again, consider the price): 1) non-adjustable rack; one position in the middle of the oven. 2) tiny markings on the dials; turn on the overhead kitchen lights and start squinting to see the markings. 3) that non-adjustable rack and small cavity size brings the top of the food very close to the upper heating element, so keep an eye on those large potatoes so they don't burn on top. 4) the timer goes only to 30 minutes; not enough time to bake a potato. So keep an eye on it so you can crank the timer around again when it shuts off after 30 minutes. 5) the exterior does get quite hot, so give other things on your counter some clearance.Definitely not an all purpose do-it-all, but for the price a quite serviceable appliance to bake your potatoes, make some toast, toast an english muffin or bagel (use the broil setting) or bake some frozen french fries.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It works really well, a little too well, maybe it’s just me?
reviews.reviewText: Well I love it first off, I am primarily using it to toast bread and if I need to do something else I may. And sure I could’ve gotten a regular toaster but we don’t even have a microwave and so going back in forth between getting a microwave, toaster, or air fryer I felt like for me this toaster oven or convection oven just makes everything easier for me, as my husband isn’t big on breakfast and would eat toast with butter the majority of the time, don’t get me wrong he loves my cooking he just can’t eat specific foods due to his condition, but thats besides the point, the reason for my title is well I used it this morning for toasting bread and nearly burnt the bread! I read the directions and left the kitchen momentarily, it definitely took less then “10 mins” as described in the yellow note provided with the instructions, either I wasn’t using my brain or it was just one of those days but I did read those directions, but you know you learn as you go I love it so far, and hopefully will remain that way. Provided some pictures.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent toaster oven
reviews.reviewText: It’s a Black and Decker toaster oven for a great price, of course you should buy it! I’ve had mine since b/f Christmas and works perfect!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My other one of 10+ years finally broke. I bought this as a replacement, I love it. The dials are easy to use and the crumb tray is easy to clean. My mom who needs glasses for everything is able to see the dials once I put stickers on for her two most used settings.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Works but controls could be better...
reviews.reviewText: Controls seem very old school, hard to not over toast aka burn it.You have to spin a dial past 10 minutes and then force it back to pictures of toast.My carbon footprint got larger while I figured out where to spin it...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best toaster EVER!
reviews.reviewText: To tell the truth, the only thing I use this for is f9r toasting bread, English muffins, etc. I haven’t tried anything else yet, but THAT is what I bought it for! I’ve had multiple toasters across the years, and they never seem to get it right! Under toasted, over toasted. You can’t see how the toasting is going, so you pop it up, put it down, etc. With this unit I can actually SEE what is going on! Toasted beautifully on both top and bottom every time. The other day I tried frozen waffels. Way better than the toaster. Funny thing is that is actully cheaper than the toaster I just tossed out. Highy recommend if you want a good toaster. Everything else is a bonus!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for the price, toasts very fast!
reviews.reviewText: Like this one and easy to clean! Does the job!
Black & decker es sinónimo de calidad , excelente artículo

reviews.reviewTitle: Great toaster oven for the value
reviews.reviewText: Great toaster oven and works great. Excellent value for the money and would highly recommend.
Uso este modelo hace 30 años y me encanta este es el 3o que compro, lo único que veo es que el precio aquí en Mexico es l doble que en EU
Simple. Great value. Works great. Very hot.
